content.question: Which of the following statements is best supported by the data shown in the table?

choices.label: Passage of rainwater through the green roofs increased the acidity of the water from the increased formation of carbonic acid.
Green roofs reduced levels of ammonium because the vegetation absorbed the pollutant.
Green roofs are effective at removing all pollutants from rainwater because the plants can absorb the toxins from the precipitation.
Green roofs do little to improve rainwater runoff quality as most pollutants are not significantly different from the control roofs.

content.answer: Green roofs reduced levels of ammonium because the vegetation absorbed the pollutant.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
